cyclone.name: BERYL
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, forecast to cross the Lesser Antilles tonight, then pass near or just south of the U.S. Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico on Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Leeward / northern Windward Islands (near Dominica-Guadeloupe) before tracking south of the Virgin Islands

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Lesser Antilles, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds possible Monday; chance (13%) of sustained 34-kt tropical-storm force winds with higher gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along St. Croix’s coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain with locally higher pockets Monday into early Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and high surf in surrounding coastal waters could affect vessel operations.
